sense.name: be cognizant, realize
sense.examples: I know that the President lied to the people. I know that I left the key on the table. Galileo knew that the earth moves around the sun. The child knew right from wrong.

sense.name: recognize, be familar or well-versed with
sense.examples: I know this flower as a Peruvian Lily. Do you know my sister? He was known to them by a different name. I know Latin. We all knew her as a big show-off. I would know that voice anywhere. She is the bravest woman I've ever known. A priori knowledge is something we know apart from experience. Only the twins' mother knew them apart.

sense.name: have the ability or know-how
sense.examples: I know how to ride a horse. Does your husband know how to cook? I know the right way to approach a strange dog.

sense.name: experience
sense.examples: Have you ever known hunger? We knew real terror when the car began rolling down the cliff. That time in Venice was the most wonderful experience I've ever known.

sense.name: acknowledge, discern, recognize
sense.commentary: NOTE: In this sense, the entity known is imbued with a quality.
sense.examples: We know your words to be true. We know the Cherokee Nation to be a sovereign state. His greed knew no limits Her love knows no bounds.
